title: Revelation Chapter 5 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Revelation chapter 5 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Revelation Chapter 5 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Revelation Chapter 5.

questions.question: What was written on the book seen in the right hand of Him who sat on the throne?
options: Written within and on the backside
Written only on the front
Written in gold letters
Written in a foreign language
questions.correctAnswer: Written within and on the backside
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:1 states the book was written within and on the backside.

questions.question: Who proclaimed with a loud voice asking who was worthy to open the book?
options: A strong angel
One of the elders
The Lamb
A voice from heaven
questions.correctAnswer: A strong angel
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:2 describes a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice.

questions.question: True or False: According to Revelation 5:3, no man in heaven, earth, or under the earth was able to open the book.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:3 clearly states no man was able to open the book or look on it.

questions.question: Why did John weep much according to Revelation 5:4?
options: Because no man was found worthy to open and read the book
Because he was alone in heaven
Because of the loud voices
Because the seals were broken
questions.correctAnswer: Because no man was found worthy to open and read the book
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:4 says John wept because no one was found worthy to open or read the book.

questions.question: Who is described as the Lion of the tribe of Juda and the Root of David?
options: The one who prevailed to open the book
One of the elders
A strong angel
The author of the scroll
questions.correctAnswer: The one who prevailed to open the book
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:5 identifies the Lion of the tribe of Juda and the Root of David as the one who prevailed to open the book.

questions.question: What figure stood in the midst of the throne, beasts, and elders?
options: A Lamb as it had been slain
A mighty angel
A golden calf
A man clothed in white
questions.correctAnswer: A Lamb as it had been slain
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:6 describes a Lamb standing in the midst of the throne and others.

questions.question: True or False: The Lamb had seven horns and seven eyes which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:6 states the Lamb had seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God.

questions.question: What did the Lamb do when he took the book from the right hand of Him who sat on the throne?
options: The four beasts and twenty-four elders fell down and worshipped
He opened the book immediately
He gave it to John
He hid the book
questions.correctAnswer: The four beasts and twenty-four elders fell down and worshipped
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:7-8 shows after the Lamb took the book, the beasts and elders worshipped Him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The twenty-four elders had harps and golden vials full of _______, which are the prayers of saints.
options: odours
water
gold
incense
questions.correctAnswer: odours
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:8 describes the golden vials as full of odours, which are the prayers of saints.

questions.question: What did the new song sung by the creatures say the Lamb was worthy to do?
options: To take the book and open the seals thereof
To sit on the throne forever
To judge the nations
To create a new heaven and earth
questions.correctAnswer: To take the book and open the seals thereof
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:9 states the Lamb is worthy to take the book and open the seals.

questions.question: What has the Lamb done to redeem people according to Revelation 5:9?
options: Was slain and redeemed us by His blood
Preached the gospel to all nations
Gave commandments to follow
Built the temple in heaven
questions.correctAnswer: Was slain and redeemed us by His blood
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:9 says the Lamb was slain and redeemed us to God by His blood.

questions.question: According to Revelation 5:10, what roles has the Lamb made the redeemed to be?
options: Kings and priests
Prophets and teachers
Fishermen and shepherds
Judges and rulers
questions.correctAnswer: Kings and priests
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:10 says the Lamb has made us kings and priests to God.

questions.question: True or False: The number of angels around the throne was described as thousands.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:11 describes the number of angels as ten thousand times ten thousand and thousands of thousands, far more than just thousands.

questions.question: What seven attributes did the Lamb receive according to Revelation 5:12?
options: Power, riches, wisdom, strength, honour, glory, and blessing
Love, mercy, peace, joy, patience, kindness, and goodness
Faith, hope, charity, grace, truth, peace, and joy
Justice, judgment, mercy, grace, power, wisdom, and love
questions.correctAnswer: Power, riches, wisdom, strength, honour, glory, and blessing
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:12 lists these seven attributes given to the Lamb.

questions.question: Who did every creature in heaven, earth, and under the earth bless according to Revelation 5:13?
options: Him that sitteth upon the throne and the Lamb
The elders and the beasts
The strong angel
John the Revelator
questions.correctAnswer: Him that sitteth upon the throne and the Lamb
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:13 says every creature blessed Him that sits on the throne and the Lamb.

medium.title: Revelation Chapter 5 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Revelation Chapter 5 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with feelings of unworthiness in their service to God. Based on Revelation 5, what biblical truth would you share about who is worthy to open the book and why?
options: Only the Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David, is worthy because He has prevailed
No one in heaven or on earth is worthy to open the book
Only angels are worthy to open the book
Every elder is worthy because of their holiness
questions.correctAnswer: Only the Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David, is worthy because He has prevailed
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:2-5 teaches that no man in heaven, earth, or under the earth was found worthy to open the book, but the Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David, prevailed to open it, showing that Christ alone is worthy due to His victory.

questions.question: How does Revelation 5 encourage believers to approach prayer and worship in light of Christ's worthiness?
options: By offering prayers as fragrant incense and worship through song recognizing Christ's redeeming work
By praying silently without expressing praise
By focusing only on personal needs without worship
By worshiping angels as intermediaries
questions.correctAnswer: By offering prayers as fragrant incense and worship through song recognizing Christ's redeeming work
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:8-9 shows the elders holding golden vials full of prayers and singing a new song praising Christ's worthiness because He was slain to redeem us, teaching the importance of worship and prayer as acts of devotion.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged because they feel their prayers are not heard. What does Revelation 5 teach about the value of prayers?
options: Prayers are precious and represented as golden vials full of incense before God
Prayers are ignored until we are worthy
Only prayers of elders are accepted
Prayers must be spoken aloud to be effective
questions.correctAnswer: Prayers are precious and represented as golden vials full of incense before God
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:8 depicts the elders holding golden vials full of odours, which symbolize the prayers of saints, showing that God values and receives the prayers of His people.

questions.question: What practical lesson about humility and trust in Christ does Revelation 5 provide when facing trials and spiritual challenges?
options: Trust that Christ alone is worthy and able to open the book and bring victory
Rely on your own strength to overcome challenges
Seek human leaders to solve spiritual problems
Ignore difficulties and pretend everything is fine
questions.correctAnswer: Trust that Christ alone is worthy and able to open the book and bring victory
questions.explanation: Verses Revelation 5:5-6 show that Christ, the Lamb who was slain, is the only one worthy to open the seals, teaching believers to depend on Him alone for victory and strength in trials.

questions.question: How does Revelation 5 guide believers in their role as witnesses to the Gospel?
options: By recognizing Christ’s redeeming work that brings people from every nation to God
By focusing only on their own local community
By avoiding sharing the Gospel to prevent conflict
By relying solely on church leaders to evangelize
questions.correctAnswer: By recognizing Christ’s redeeming work that brings people from every nation to God
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:9 emphasizes Christ's redemption of people from every kindred, tongue, people, and nation, encouraging believers to share the Gospel widely as witnesses to this universal salvation.

questions.question: A fellow believer is overwhelmed by the responsibilities of church leadership. Based on Revelation 5, what encouragement can you share about their role in God’s kingdom?
options: God has made us kings and priests to reign on earth, empowering our service
Leadership is only for angels and elders
Serving in the church is optional and not significant
Only those without weaknesses should serve
questions.correctAnswer: God has made us kings and priests to reign on earth, empowering our service
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:10 teaches that believers are made kings and priests to serve God and reign on earth, encouraging faithful service despite challenges.

questions.question: What does Revelation 5 teach about God’s sovereignty and power that can help believers maintain contentment and gratitude in daily work and life?
options: The Lamb is worthy to receive power, riches, wisdom, strength, honor, glory, and blessing
We earn God’s favor through our own efforts
God’s power is limited to spiritual matters only
Only angels possess true wisdom and strength
questions.correctAnswer: The Lamb is worthy to receive power, riches, wisdom, strength, honor, glory, and blessing
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:12 shows that the Lamb is worthy of all these attributes, reminding believers that God is sovereign over all aspects of life, which encourages trust and gratitude in Him.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 5 teaches that no creature in heaven, on earth, under the earth, or in the sea praises God and the Lamb forever.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:13 states that every creature in all these places praises God and the Lamb forever, highlighting universal worship and glory to God.

questions.question: True or False: According to Revelation 5, believers should weep when no one is found worthy to open the book.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:4 describes John weeping much because no one was found worthy to open and read the book, showing the deep longing for God’s redemptive plan to unfold.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In Revelation 5, the Lamb is described as having seven _____ and seven _____, which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.
options: horns and eyes
wings and horns
eyes and wings
horns and wings
questions.correctAnswer: horns and eyes
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:6 describes the Lamb as having seven horns and seven eyes, symbolizing perfect power and knowledge through the Spirit of God.

questions.question: How does Revelation 5 teach us about perseverance through trials and the importance of worship?
options: By showing that despite no one being worthy at first, Christ’s victory brings hope and the elders worship Him continually
By instructing believers to give up when trials arise
By focusing only on earthly rewards
By discouraging public worship
questions.correctAnswer: By showing that despite no one being worthy at first, Christ’s victory brings hope and the elders worship Him continually
questions.explanation: Verses 5:4-5 and 5:14 demonstrate the initial sorrow and subsequent joy when Christ is revealed worthy, encouraging perseverance and continuous worship.

questions.question: A believer struggles with pride in their spiritual achievements. What does Revelation 5 teach about humility before God?
options: Only the Lamb is worthy, and all creatures worship Him, showing true humility
Pride is justified because of personal holiness
Humility is unnecessary if you serve in church leadership
Angels are more worthy than humans
questions.correctAnswer: Only the Lamb is worthy, and all creatures worship Him, showing true humility
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:11-14 reveals that all beings praise the Lamb, emphasizing that humility is recognizing God’s worthiness above all.

questions.question: What biblical principle about stewardship can be drawn from the imagery of the book sealed with seven seals in Revelation 5?
options: God’s plans are perfect and must be trusted until He reveals them in His timing
We can open God’s plans whenever we want
Secrecy is unimportant in God’s work
The seals represent hidden knowledge to be kept from believers
questions.correctAnswer: God’s plans are perfect and must be trusted until He reveals them in His timing
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:1-3 shows the book sealed with seven seals that no one could open, teaching believers to trust God’s sovereign timing and plans.

questions.question: How does Revelation 5 illustrate the role of the church in worship and service to God?
options: The elders and beasts worship the Lamb and present prayers, showing the church’s role in intercession and praise
Only individuals worship, not the church collectively
The church is to focus on legalistic rules
The church’s role is to judge others
questions.correctAnswer: The elders and beasts worship the Lamb and present prayers, showing the church’s role in intercession and praise
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:8 describes elders and beasts offering prayers and worship, symbolizing the church’s active role in prayer and praise.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to rely on self-effort for spiritual breakthroughs. What truth from Revelation 5 counters this temptation?
options: Only the Lamb who was slain is worthy and able to open the book, showing reliance on Christ alone
Self-effort is the main key to spiritual success
Human wisdom is superior to divine power
Spiritual breakthroughs come from luck
questions.correctAnswer: Only the Lamb who was slain is worthy and able to open the book, showing reliance on Christ alone
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:5-7 focuses on Christ’s unique worthiness to open the book, teaching that spiritual victory comes through Him, not self-effort.

hard.title: Revelation Chapter 5 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Revelation Chapter 5.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals' as seen in Revelation 5:1?
options: It symbolizes God's complete and perfect plan for judgment and redemption.
It represents the laws given to Moses on Mount Sinai.
It refers to the scroll of Psalms used in worship.
It indicates a secret message only angels can understand.
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes God's complete and perfect plan for judgment and redemption.
questions.explanation: The sealed book with seven seals represents the fullness of God's sovereign plan, hinted in Revelation 5:1, where the number seven symbolizes completeness in biblical literature.

questions.question: Who is described as the only one worthy to open the book and break its seven seals in Revelation 5?
options: The Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David
Michael the Archangel
The strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice
John the Apostle
questions.correctAnswer: The Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:5 explicitly identifies the worthy one as the Lion of the tribe of Judah and Root of David, titles alluding to Messianic prophecies in Genesis 49:9-10 and Isaiah 11:1, signifying Jesus Christ.

questions.question: In Revelation 5:6, the Lamb has 'seven horns and seven eyes.' What do the 'seven eyes' represent?
options: The seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth
The seven churches mentioned earlier in Revelation
The seven angels who stand before God
The seven days of creation
questions.correctAnswer: The seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth
questions.explanation: The seven eyes symbolize the seven Spirits of God, indicating the fullness of the Spirit's presence and activity throughout the earth, as stated in Revelation 5:6.

questions.question: What literary device is prominently used when the four beasts and twenty-four elders fall before the Lamb with harps and golden vials full of odours in Revelation 5:8?
options: Symbolism representing worship and the prayers of the saints
Allegory describing the heavenly court
Parable illustrating divine judgment
Metaphor for the church's mission on earth
questions.correctAnswer: Symbolism representing worship and the prayers of the saints
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:8 uses symbolism where the harps and golden vials full of odours represent worship and the prayers of the saints, emphasizing the connection between heavenly worship and believers’ prayers.

questions.question: The new song sung in Revelation 5:9 declares the Lamb worthy because He was slain and has redeemed people from every kindred and tongue. This foreshadows which New Testament theological theme?
options: The universal scope of Christ's redemptive work
The exclusivity of salvation to one ethnic group
The necessity of temple sacrifices
The importance of the Mosaic Law
questions.correctAnswer: The universal scope of Christ's redemptive work
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:9 emphasizes that Christ’s redemptive work extends to people from every nation and language, aligning with New Testament teaching in passages like Galatians 3:28 about the inclusive nature of salvation.

questions.question: According to Revelation 5:10, what roles have the redeemed been made unto God?
options: Kings and priests
Prophets and judges
Shepherds and teachers
Servants and scribes
questions.correctAnswer: Kings and priests
questions.explanation: The text in Revelation 5:10 states that the redeemed are made kings and priests, which echoes Old Testament typology of priest-kings (e.g., Melchizedek) and New Testament teaching about the priesthood of believers (1 Peter 2:9).

questions.question: The vast number of angels 'ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands' in Revelation 5:11 is an example of what biblical literary technique?
options: Hyperbolic numeric expression to denote innumerable multitude
Literal counting of angelic hosts
Numerical symbolism representing seven churches
A coded reference to the tribes of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Hyperbolic numeric expression to denote innumerable multitude
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:11 uses hyperbolic numbers to express an innumerable multitude of angels, a common apocalyptic device to convey overwhelming heavenly worship.

questions.question: Which series of attributes is ascribed to the Lamb in the loud voice proclamation in Revelation 5:12?
options: Power, riches, wisdom, strength, honour, glory, blessing
Mercy, justice, truth, peace, love, faith, hope
Holiness, righteousness, patience, kindness, humility, grace, faithfulness
Glory, majesty, dominion, holiness, mercy, truth, judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Power, riches, wisdom, strength, honour, glory, blessing
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:12 lists these seven attributes, which correspond to divine qualities and echo Old Testament doxologies such as in Daniel 2:20-23, emphasizing the Lamb’s divine worthiness.

questions.question: The universal praise by 'every creature in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and in the sea' in Revelation 5:13 suggests what theological concept?
options: Cosmic sovereignty of God and the Lamb
Exclusive worship by angelic beings only
Judgment limited to the earth
Separation of heaven and earth worship
questions.correctAnswer: Cosmic sovereignty of God and the Lamb
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:13 portrays universal worship across all realms, symbolizing the cosmic sovereignty and eternal reign of God and the Lamb, consistent with themes in Psalms 148 and Isaiah 66.

questions.question: True or False: According to Revelation 5:3, some beings in heaven were able to open the sealed book.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:3 clearly states that no one in heaven, on earth, or under the earth was able to open the book or look into it.

questions.question: The phrase 'having seven horns and seven eyes' in Revelation 5:6 is an example of which Old Testament typological motif?
options: The perfect completeness and omnipotence of the Messiah
The seven days of creation
The seven seals of judgment
The seven lampstands representing churches
questions.correctAnswer: The perfect completeness and omnipotence of the Messiah
questions.explanation: Horns often symbolize power in biblical symbolism (e.g., Daniel 7), and seven denotes completeness, so the lamb’s seven horns and eyes signify the Messiah's full power and divine insight (Revelation 5:6).

questions.question: What cultural or historical significance does the 'Lion of the tribe of Juda' title carry in Revelation 5:5?
options: It connects Jesus to the royal tribe of Judah and Messianic prophecy.
It refers to a Roman emperor's symbol.
It is a title exclusive to angels in Jewish literature.
It denotes a pagan deity worshiped in the first century.
questions.correctAnswer: It connects Jesus to the royal tribe of Judah and Messianic prophecy.
questions.explanation: The title alludes to Genesis 49:9-10 and Isaiah 11:1-10, affirming Jesus' royal lineage and fulfillment of Messianic promises, as cited in Revelation 5:5.

questions.question: In Revelation 5:14, who says 'Amen' and who falls down to worship 'him that liveth for ever and ever'?
options: The four beasts say 'Amen' and the twenty-four elders worship
The twenty-four elders say 'Amen' and the four beasts worship
The angels say 'Amen' and the elders worship
The saints say 'Amen' and the angels worship
questions.correctAnswer: The four beasts say 'Amen' and the twenty-four elders worship
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:14 specifically describes the four beasts affirming with 'Amen' and the elders falling down in worship before the eternal one.

questions.question: Which Old Testament figure is alluded to by the title 'Root of David' in Revelation 5:5?
options: The Messiah who comes from David's lineage
King Solomon
Prophet Samuel
King Saul
questions.correctAnswer: The Messiah who comes from David's lineage
questions.explanation: The title 'Root of David' is a Messianic term indicating the Messiah’s origin from David’s line, referring to Jesus Christ as prophesied in Isaiah 11:1 and Revelation 5:5.

questions.question: What does the imagery of 'golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints' in Revelation 5:8 suggest about the relationship between worship and prayer?
options: That prayers are a fragrant offering before God in heavenly worship
That prayers are only symbolic and ineffective
That worship is distinct and unrelated to prayers
That only angelic prayers are acceptable
questions.correctAnswer: That prayers are a fragrant offering before God in heavenly worship
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:8 uses incense imagery common in Levitical worship to show that the prayers of believers are valued and presented as a pleasing aroma before God.

theological.title: Revelation Chapter 5 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Revelation Chapter 5 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What is described as being in the right hand of Him who sat on the throne?
options: A book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals
A scroll with seven horns and seven eyes
A golden vial full of odours
A harp
questions.correctAnswer: A book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:1 describes a book held in the right hand of the One on the throne, written inside and on the back, sealed with seven seals. This imagery recalls prophetic scrolls such as in Ezekiel 2:9-10 and the scroll in Daniel 12:4, symbolizing God's revealed plan and authority.

questions.question: Who was proclaimed with a loud voice asking who is worthy to open the book?
options: A strong angel
One of the elders
The Lamb
John the Apostle
questions.correctAnswer: A strong angel
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:2 states that a strong angel proclaimed loudly asking who is worthy to open the book. Angels as messengers and proclaimers are consistent throughout Scripture (Hebrews 1:14; Luke 2:10).

questions.question: According to Revelation 5, who was able to open the book and look inside it?
options: No one in heaven, earth, or under the earth
Only the four beasts
Only the twenty-four elders
All the angels
questions.correctAnswer: No one in heaven, earth, or under the earth
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:3 states that no one in heaven, on earth, or under the earth was able to open the book or look inside it. This emphasizes the uniqueness of Christ's worthiness (Psalm 89:27; Isaiah 53:11).

questions.question: Why did John weep much according to Revelation 5?
options: Because no one was found worthy to open the book or look inside
Because he was alone on the island
Because the angels did not worship
Because the seals were broken
questions.correctAnswer: Because no one was found worthy to open the book or look inside
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:4 reports John wept because no one was worthy to open or read the book. This highlights humanity's inability to redeem itself (Psalm 40:6-8; Isaiah 64:6).

questions.question: Who is identified as worthy to open the book and loose the seven seals in Revelation 5?
options: The Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David
One of the elders
The strong angel
John the Apostle
questions.correctAnswer: The Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:5 identifies the worthy one as the Lion of Judah and Root of David, titles referring to Christ's messianic lineage and kingship (Genesis 49:9; Isaiah 11:1; Jeremiah 23:5).

questions.question: What figure stood in the midst of the throne, the four beasts, and the elders, described as having seven horns and seven eyes?
options: A Lamb as though slain
A mighty angel
One of the twenty-four elders
The strong angel
questions.correctAnswer: A Lamb as though slain
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:6 depicts a Lamb slain but standing with seven horns and eyes, symbolizing perfect power and knowledge, as the seven Spirits of God sent throughout the earth (Zechariah 3:8; Isaiah 11:2).

questions.question: What do the seven horns and seven eyes of the Lamb represent?
options: The seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth
The seven churches
The seven angels
The seven seals
questions.correctAnswer: The seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:6 explains the seven horns and seven eyes symbolize the seven Spirits of God sent out into all the earth, representing fullness of divine power and Spirit (Isaiah 11:2; Zechariah 4:10).

questions.question: What do the twenty-four elders and four beasts hold when they fall before the Lamb?
options: Harps and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints
Swords and shields
Crowns and robes
Scrolls and trumpets
questions.correctAnswer: Harps and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:8 reveals that the elders and beasts hold harps and golden bowls full of incense, symbolizing the prayers of the saints (Psalm 141:2; Luke 1:10).

questions.question: What is the reason given for the Lamb's worthiness to open the book in the new song?
options: Because He was slain and redeemed us by His blood from every tribe and nation
Because He created heaven and earth
Because He is an angel
Because He is a strong warrior
questions.correctAnswer: Because He was slain and redeemed us by His blood from every tribe and nation
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:9 states the Lamb is worthy because He was slain and redeemed people by His blood from every tribe, language, people, and nation, emphasizing salvation by Christ's atoning sacrifice (Isaiah 53:5; Ephesians 1:7).

questions.question: What role have the redeemed been made into according to Revelation 5?
options: Kings and priests who shall reign on the earth
Prophets and teachers
Angels and messengers
Judges and scribes
questions.correctAnswer: Kings and priests who shall reign on the earth
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:10 declares that the redeemed are made kings and priests to God and will reign on earth, reflecting the priesthood of all believers (Exodus 19:6; 1 Peter 2:9).

questions.question: How many angels did John hear around the throne, the beasts, and the elders?
options: Ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands
One hundred and forty-four thousand
Seven angels
Four beasts
questions.correctAnswer: Ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:11 describes a vast number of angels numbering ten thousand times ten thousand and thousands of thousands, signifying the immense heavenly host (Daniel 7:10; Hebrews 12:22).

questions.question: What attributes does the loud voice say the Lamb who was slain is worthy to receive?
options: Power, riches, wisdom, strength, honour, glory, and blessing
Glory, war, might, and dominion
Love, mercy, peace, and grace
Justice, judgment, wrath, and vengeance
questions.correctAnswer: Power, riches, wisdom, strength, honour, glory, and blessing
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:12 exalts the Lamb as worthy to receive power, riches, wisdom, strength, honour, glory, and blessing, encompassing divine attributes (Psalm 29:1-2; Daniel 7:13-14).

questions.question: Who receives blessing, honour, glory, and power forever and ever according to Revelation 5?
options: Him who sits on the throne and the Lamb
The twenty-four elders
The four beasts
The strong angel
questions.correctAnswer: Him who sits on the throne and the Lamb
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:13 affirms that every creature in heaven, earth, and under the earth blesses and honors both the One on the throne and the Lamb forever, emphasizing the unity of God the Father and the Son (Psalm 148; Hebrews 1:6).

questions.question: What was the response of the four beasts and the twenty-four elders after the great doxology in Revelation 5?
options: The four beasts said Amen, and the elders fell down and worshipped Him who lives forever
They shouted hallelujah and sang a new song
They blew trumpets and gave thanks
They opened the seven seals
questions.correctAnswer: The four beasts said Amen, and the elders fell down and worshipped Him who lives forever
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:14 shows the four beasts saying Amen and the elders worshipping the eternal living One, reflecting worship and affirming God's eternal sovereignty (Psalm 95:6; Isaiah 6:1-3).

questions.question: The Lamb is described as having been slain but is now standing in the midst of the throne. What theological truth does this convey?
options: The victory of Christ through His sacrificial death and resurrection
The Lamb is weak and powerless
The Lamb is a symbol of innocence only
The Lamb is an angelic being
questions.correctAnswer: The victory of Christ through His sacrificial death and resurrection
questions.explanation: Revelation 5:6's image of the slain Lamb standing symbolizes Christ's triumph over death by His resurrection, a central Christian doctrine (Isaiah 53:7-10; 1 Corinthians 15:3-4; Hebrews 7:26-28).
